question: Which of the following functions is performed by a Black hole?
option1: It does not emit any radiations
option2: It converts UV/radiations to infra-rec1 radiations
option3: It absorbs all the radiations that fall on it
option4: It is an imaginary concept in Physics
answer: It absorbs all the radiations that fall on it
explanation: A black hole is a region of spacetime exhibiting gravitational acceleration so strong that nothing—no particles or even electromagnetic radiation such as light—can escape from it. The theory of general relativity predicts that a sufficiently compact mass can deform spacetime to form a black hole.
